skillTree.localised_description: An impossibly large and foul reptilian horror, the Toad Dragon known as Bubebolos is as strong as he is perpetually ravenous.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit is branded with the Mark of Nurgle, and is affected by Nurgle Authority.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

Enemies hit by vortex in melee combat

skillTree.localised_description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.localised_description: Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Tamurkhan and his army don't get tired, and they never, ever give up.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

skillTree.localised_description: Heeding rumours that the Favoured of Nurgle is one of the fabled four Sons of the Great Kurgan, mortal followers of Chaos bow to his command.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for non-Daemonic units
	(own army)

Recruitment cost: -25% for non-Daemonic units
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Tamurkhan is much more than the giant corpse maggot whose form he took; he is now a being of untold power, thanks to his dear Grandfather's love and care.
The Maggot  is especially tough and durable, even for one of his kind, and can survive just about anything the various worlds can throw at him.
After killing and inhabiting the body of a great Ogre Tyrant, the followers of the Maw have fallen to Tamurkhan's corruption.

skillTree.localised_description: Bubebolos stands above others as the largest of his kind. With Tamurkhan upon his back, all other Toad Dragons fall into line.

skillTree.localised_description: As Tamurkhan leads a devastating army of corrupted mortals and Daemons, like-minded forces attracted by his Ruin converge to form his grand warhost.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -25%
	(own armies in province)

Upkeep: -25% for all units
	(own armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

skillTree.localised_description: Grandfather loves the smallest of his many children at least as much as his myriad other grim creations, if not more so.

skillTree.localised_description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

skillTree.localised_description: Sulphurous, acerbic disease is no respecter of rank, nobility or prowess in battle; all shall fall afore Nurgle's filthy infections.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption – as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is branded with the Mark of Nurgle, and is affected by Nurgle Authority.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Maggot Lord will conquer all in Nurgle's name, butchering a bloody path across the realms, until rotting corpses are all that remain.

effects.description: Has access to Tamurkhan's Chieftains providing unique Heroes, units and abilities

items.colour_text: Gifted to him by the Chaos Dwarfs of the Black Mountains, the greyish fumes produced when this weapon is swung are foully poisonous... which pleases the Maggot Lord greatly!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Tamurkhan's utterly fearsome reputation walks, or rather slithers, before him.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Maggot Lord is so contagious that he has only to slither past someone to infect them with his foul pestilence.
